meanings.definition: The state or quality of not being able to be enforced.
meanings.sent1: The nonenforceabilities of the rule led to chaos in the classroom.
meanings.sent2: The government struggled with the nonenforceabilities of the new law.
meanings.sent3: Trying to enforce the unenforceable nonenforceabilities of the policy was like chasing a shadow.
meanings.sent4: The nonenforceabilities of the contract were as slippery as a fish in a pond.
meanings.sent5: The teacher explained the nonenforceabilities of the assignment using a simple analogy.

meanings.sent1: The company's nonenforceabilities caused confusion among the employees.
meanings.sent2: Legal experts debated the validity of the nonenforceabilities in the contract.
meanings.sent3: The nonenforceabilities of the parking regulations left everyone scratching their heads.
meanings.sent4: Her stubbornness was like the nonenforceabilities of a wild horse.
meanings.sent5: The lawyer highlighted the nonenforceabilities of the agreement during the trial.
